Any awstats experts in the house?: How can I apply a config file (like the one from Awstats), so new settings will be applied?
the example one?
by default it looks at /etc/awstats/awstats.conf and /etc/awstats/awstats.conf.local (which is where you should make changes ideally)
by default awstats only updates every 10 minutes
It's not about updating but about new settings.
Or should that be done automatically?
I don't think it will re-generate existing stats, you'd need to clear out its data and run all your logs through it again manually
Is it not so that it should just use the new settings?
it probably will use the new settings for new logs, but it won't magically figure out all the extra information from your old logs
What if it doesn't use the setting for new logs..
then you'd need to investigate as to why
The problem is that it doesn't recognise browser and robots.
hit the website a few times and wait until the next awstats cron job has run (tail -f /var/log/syslog) and see if it's doing it now
It didn't :(
Logs are set combined, Awstats is set to read them as combined and Awstats is set to recognise robots. I have also waited through several cron and even restarted Apache. Still no luck..
has the site had any hits in that time? it may well be that no robots have been to it since you updated the configs
Yes, google, me and yahoo have visited it.
well then i would suggest that you check the configs again, but it definitely does work because I use awstats and combined logs

nope
